author: Phil
content: You’re correct. I got the years messed up. I thought they just found the fish.

author: Phil
content: That earthquake was felt as far south as Tokyo so it’s hard to say how far the fish will swim.

author: Rick Spilman
content: The paper describing the DNA analysis was published a couple of weeks ago. The fish themselves were videoed and caught in 2016, so any association with current earthquakes seems unlikely.

author: Phil
content:
Snakes and fishes are common animals in reports dealing with unusual animal behaviour prior to an earthquake. Both organisms possess particular sense organs: snakes can perceive vibrations and infrared radiation, fishes perceive electric fields. … Before the Wenchuan earthquake (7.8 magnitude, 12.05.Dec 12, 2011
https://blogs.scientificamerican.com/history-of-geology/can-animals-sense-earthquakes/#:~:text=Snakes%20and%20fishes%20are%20common,radiation%2C%20fishes%20perceive%20electric%20fields.&text=Before%20the%20Wenchuan%20earthquake%20(7.8%20magnitude%2C%2012.05.

author: Phil
content:
Correction.

Animals detect changes in electrical and magnetic currents that we can’t. The sence things are about to change.
Look it up.

author: Willy
content: So the earthquake moved the fish to the deep ocean. Trying to understand relevance.

author: Phil
content:
New fukushima earthquake 7.3

A powerful magnitude 7.3 earthquake struck late Saturday off the coast of Tohoku, leaving at least 50 people injured and knocking multiple power plants offline.
